abstract.p: Mark Woodforde and Todd Woodbridge win men's doubles championship at French Open (S)

block.p: The Australians Mark Woodforde and Todd Woodbridge won the only Grand Slam doubles title missing from their collection today, defeating Sandon Stolle of Australia and Paul Haarhuis of the Netherlands, 7-6, (7), 6-4.

Their 58th title, their 10th in a Grand Slam event, gave them the most in the Open era. Tied at 57 are two teams: the Americans Peter Fleming and John McEnroe and the South Africans Bob Hewitt and Frew McMillan.

The Australians Mark Woodforde and Todd Woodbridge won the only Grand Slam doubles title missing from their collection today, defeating Sandon Stolle of Australia and Paul Haarhuis of the Netherlands, 7-6, (7), 6-4.

Their 58th title, their 10th in a Grand Slam event, gave them the most in the Open era. Tied at 57 are two teams: the Americans Peter Fleming and John McEnroe and the South Africans Bob Hewitt and Frew McMillan.
''I saw John in the locker room today,'' Woodbridge said of McEnroe, now a television analyst. ''He came up and said, 'Best of luck, sort of.' ''
